description: Batter Nashra Sandhu experienced an unusual hit-wicket dismissal during Pakistan's innings as Bangladesh secured a commanding seven-wicket victory in the Women's World Cup 2025. Rubya Haider's unbeaten half-century and Marufa Akter's decisive bowling, which included two early ducks, restricted Pakistan to 129 runs, allowing Bangladesh to chase the target comfortably.

description: Once the political and cultural centre of India, the States that comprise the Hindi heartland are now anchored to restrictive social ideas

title: Life-saving checks for early detection of cancer and prevention
description: Cancers often grow silently without symptoms, presenting at late stages when treatments are complex, expensive, and less effective. But when detected early, cancers are more often curable, require less aggressive treatments, and survival can improve dramatically

title: The cost of convenience:  health hazards as a side effect of using digital tools
description: India generated 2.2 million metric tonnes of e-waste in 2025, making it the third-largest e-waste generator globally, after China and the United States. A majority of this is informally recycled, leading to the release of toxic substances into the air and water, impacting the health of both e-waste workers and communities at large

title: ABVP, Left groups clash over Durga Puja procession, Ravan Dahan at JNU
‘Body not found… still hopeful,’ says brother of man who drowned in Mehrauli drain while making video
IND vs WI: Record! Bumrah surpasses Kapil Dev, legends with heroics
description: Jasprit Bumrah achieved a significant milestone in Ahmedabad, becoming the fastest Indian pacer to 50 Test wickets at home in just 1,747 deliveries, surpassing Mohammed Shami. He also matched Javagal Srinath's record for innings. Bumrah's 3/42 against West Indies underscored his exceptional form, maintaining a career average below 20, a unique feat for bowlers with over 200 Test wickets.

title: ‘Space crunch’: MA Philosophy students of DU attend classes in corridor

description: Putin underlined that Russia and India have never had any problems or tensions between them and always took actions by keeping in view their sensitivities

title: Why does stirring a liquid in a cup create a vortex?
'Azad Kashmir' controversy: Pak commentator issues clarification - 'It is sad'
description: Former Pakistan captain Sana Mir faced criticism for an on-air remark during the ICC Women’s World Cup 2025. She referred to 'Azad Kashmir' while describing a player's background. Social media users demanded her removal for politicizing the broadcast. Mir issued a clarification stating her words were taken out of context.

title: Kantara Chapter 1: Rishab Shetty starrer mints Rs 60 crore; beats Chhaava, Saiyaara
description: Rishab Shetty’s highly anticipated prequel, Kantara Chapter 1, has made a sensational start, crossing ₹65 crore on its opening day. This major pan-India Dusshera release surpassed several big hits, including Rajinikanth's Coolie, showcasing its immense appeal. Celebrities like Prabhas and Jr NTR have lauded the film, directed by and starring National Award winner Rishab Shetty, for its resounding success.

title: Trump says U.S. in ‘armed conflict’ with drug cartels after ordering strikes in the Caribbean
description: The Trump administration has yet to explain how the military assessed the boats' cargo and determined the passengers' alleged gang affiliation before the strikes.

title: Violence in Bareilly | In the name of god
description: A message on an illuminated board that read ‘I love Muhammad’ during the Barawafat procession in Kanpur to celebrate the birth of the Prophet on September 4 led to violence, FIRs, arrests, an Internet shutdown, and bulldozer action in Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh. The Hindu finds that people are worried about their safety and that their businesses will suffer during peak festival season

Jason Kelce hits back at claims DiCaprio is too good for his podcast
description: Leonardo DiCaprio's guest spot on the New Heights podcast sparked debate, with critics deeming the show "beneath" the star. Jason Kelce humorously agreed, yet emphasized the podcast's unpolished, authentic style is precisely why A-list celebrities like DiCaprio and Benicio del Toro choose its candid platform over traditional media for promotions.

title: Tariff war: 'India won’t allow its humiliation', says Putin; warns US over oil pressure
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned the United States against pressuring India to stop buying Russian oil. He stated India would not tolerate humiliation. Putin mentioned Prime Minister Modi would not take such steps. He said India would suffer losses if it refused Russian energy supplies. Putin also blamed NATO countries for the Ukraine conflict.

title: MP: Tractor-trolley overturns in pond during Durga idol immersion; 11 drown
description: Eleven people, mostly teenagers, drowned in a pond in MP's Khandwa district when a tractor-trolley carrying Durga idol immersion devotees overturned on Vijayadashami. The vehicle lost balance and toppled into the water, despite a warning to the driver. Seven females and eight minors were among the deceased in the tragic accident.

title: Committee on AI comprising health authorities, academic experts formed
Tension in Bareilly: Drones are up ahead of Friday prayer; internet shut down
description: Bareilly suspended internet services, including mobile data and broadband, from October 2 to October 4, fearing unrest during Friday prayers. This precaution follows last week's clashes over an 'I Love Muhammad' procession, which led to over 80 arrests, including prominent cleric Tauqeer Raza Khan. Security remains heavily deployed across the division.

title: UP: 3 dead, 5 missing after 9 swept away in Agra; SDRF teams deployed
description: Tragedy struck Agra as three men died and five went missing during Durga idol immersion in the Utangan river on Thursday. The group entered an undesignated spot after being turned away from official sites, where strong currents swept them away. Rescue operations are underway, with one person saved so far. Authorities had warned against using non-designated immersion points.

title: Textiles to food, IKEA experiments with India-first innovations
IHC of Abu Dhabi buys 41.2% in Sammaan Capital for Rs 8,850 crore
Road to Karachi is through Sir Creek: Rajnath to Pak; warns against military build-up
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh issued a stern warning to Pakistan regarding its military build-up near the sensitive Sir Creek region, threatening a strong response that would alter the area's history and geography. He also revealed details of "Operation Sindoor," where India successfully countered Pakistani attempts to penetrate its borders, emphasizing India's targeted fight against terrorism while showing restraint.

title: Rallies against Israel interception of Gaza flotilla sweep Europe
description: "We are prepared to block everything. The genocidal machine must stop immediately," the demonstrators chanted.

title: Fifty years ago | Kamaraj passes away
1984 tension: Indira blocked Rajiv’s Bhindranwale meeting - new book claims
description: A new book highlights how political interference and missed opportunities allowed Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale to escalate tensions before 1984. Indira Gandhi's attempts for Rajiv to secretly meet Bhindranwale failed twice due to safety concerns, infuriating him. These cancellations, coupled with his quick 1981 release, led to the tragic 1984 events.

title: ‘Communal with totalitarian outlook’: Congress cites Gandhi; attacks RSS
description: Congress asserted Thursday that Mahatma Gandhi labeled RSS a “communal body with totalitarian outlook,” citing his secretary’s book. This statement came as Congress leaders honored Gandhi, contrasting with BJP’s tribute to the RSS. Spokesperson Jairam Ramesh highlighted that Sardar Patel banned RSS five months after Gandhi’s observation and later warned against groups challenging the national flag.

title: A hundred years ago | Labour laws in India: Lady Chatterjee’s complaint

Thaw in ties: India, China to restart direct flights this month; first in 5 yrs
description: India announced the resumption of direct air services with China from late October, a significant step towards normalizing bilateral relations. This follows PM Modi's recent meeting with President Xi Jinping and earlier tourist visa resumption, aiming to boost people-to-people contact and economic cooperation. IndiGo will launch Kolkata-Guangzhou flights on October 26.

title: 'Democratic system under ‘wholesale’ attack', says Rahul; BJP hits back
description: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, speaking in Colombia, asserted that India is experiencing a "wholesale attack on its democratic system," advocating for diverse traditions to flourish. He highlighted risks to India's structure. The BJP vehemently criticized his statements, accusing him of insulting the nation on foreign soil and defaming India, citing his electoral rejections as motivation for his remarks.

title: Synagogue stabbing: UK cops name 'suspected' attacker; who is Jihad Al-Shamie?
On first day of archery league, rain plays spoilsport but format holds promise
'Colossal tragedy': Leh still in shock, but firm on statehood; locals recall Sep 24
description: Ladakh faced unrest after a September 24 protest. Four people died during security forces' response. Activist Sonam Wangchuk ended his hunger strike. He sought Sixth Schedule status and statehood. Residents demand a judicial inquiry into the deaths. Local leaders continue their call for self-governance. The region seeks resolution for its demands.

title: Mirabai Chanu wins World Championships silver, lifts iron more than twice her body weight in her last attempt to stun Thai rival
In a 1st, India set to host a Taliban minister next week; cooperation on agenda
description: India's ties with the Taliban are set to intensify. Acting foreign minister Amir Khan Muttaqi will likely visit India on October 9-10. He will meet External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar. This marks the first visit by a senior Taliban official since 2021. India secured a UNSC travel ban waiver for Muttaqi.

title: Delhi Confidential: Session Warm-UP
World Para Athletics Championships: Inspired by ‘Comedy Nights with Kapil’, Atul Kaushik takes first step towards greatness with bronze medal
A true (blue) devotee
'He gets mad at me': Travis Kelce’s latest clash with Andy Reid
description: Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce voiced frustration over his steadily decreasing playing time, despite the team's recent win against the Ravens. His snap percentage dropped significantly, yet he remains highly productive this season. Coach Andy Reid acknowledged Kelce's desire to play every snap, taking responsibility for managing his reps.

title: NIRF revamp: Govt to penalise research fraud; tainted citations face cuts
description: India's National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) is undergoing a significant overhaul, introducing a negative marking system for research malpractice. Universities will face penalties for retracted papers and their citations, aiming to curb academic dishonesty and misrepresentation. This stricter approach seeks to enhance research credibility and may lead to debarment for persistent offenders, signalling zero tolerance for academic fraud.

title: How club thrower Dharambir conquered conditions to win silver at World Para Athletics Championships
Kovind quotes ex-PM Vajpayee’s ‘Bhim Smriti’ speech, hails RSS
description: Former President Ram Nath Kovind, addressing the RSS centenary, lauded Dr. B.R. Ambedkar and the Sangh Parivar's pro-Constitution stance. He quoted Atal Bihari Vajpayee's declaration of governance based on "Bhim Smriti," countering "Manuwadi" accusations. Kovind also noted Mahatma Gandhi and Ambedkar's admiration for RSS discipline and inclusivity, with Ambedkar reportedly feeling a "sense of belonging" during a 1940 visit.

title: Who is India Love? Meet Shilo Sanders’ rumored girlfriend amid his NFL future doubts
description: NFL prospect Shilo Sanders is reportedly linked to popular influencer India Love, sparking fan frenzy given his private nature. The rumors intensified after a man, believed to be Sanders, called Love during a livestream, with his voice sounding familiar. India Love, known for her reality show "The Westbrooks," has not confirmed the speculation, leaving fans eager for details.

title: Operation Sindoor a victory over ‘Ravana of terrorism’: President
description: Dasara symbolises triumph of good over evil and love over hatred, says Droupadi Murmu, urges people to slay the Ravana within for societal peace; PM Narendra Modi misses celebrations due to rain; CM burns Ravana effigy at a separate event

title: World Para Athletics Championships: What has changed in club throw?
Judge: Gandhi, Shastri life guided humanity to focus on self-reliance
description: Senior SC judge Justice Surya Kant paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi and Lal Bahadur Shastri, highlighting their philosophies of village focus, self-reliance, and simple living. He noted Gandhi's role in empowering rural masses and linking true freedom to dignity for the vulnerable and justice for the marginalized, offering enduring guidance.

title: JNUSU hits out at ABVP for burning effigy with Umar, Sharjeel’s faces
Trading firm levels graft, harassment allegations against customs staff in TN
description: Wintrack Inc. CEO Prawin Ganeshan has accused Chennai customs officials of corruption and harassment, alleging bribery demands and goods being held up. He announced halting exports and imports from India due to these issues, prompting the revenue department to launch a senior-level investigation into the serious claims. The company fears retaliation after going public.

title: Delhi Govt. to revise circle rates, seeks RWAs and owners’ feedback

title: RSS holds Shakha on govt. school premises; 45 held
IT Ministry opens real money games ban, esports registration rules, up for consultation
description: The draft Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Rules, 2025 would set up an Online Gaming Authority of India, and set a framework for registration of esports.

title: Uttar Pradesh: Sambhal mosque razed; 2nd demolition in 4 months
description: Sambhal authorities demolished a mosque and a 30,000-sq-ft marriage hall, allegedly built illegally on government pond land. These decade-old structures were declared encroachments after a recent survey. This marks the second mosque demolition in four months. Notices were issued, but owners failed to act, leading to the bulldozer action under heavy police presence.

title: Cybercrime crackdown: ED seizes Rs 8.5k cr assets; nationwide probe launched
description: The Enforcement Directorate has initiated a massive nationwide crackdown on cybercrimes across 28 cities, uncovering over Rs 28,000 crore in illicit gains and seizing assets exceeding Rs 8,500 crore. This extensive operation, involving zonal offices, has led to 106 arrests. Notable cases include the Mahadev Online Betting App, where Rs 8,000 crore was laundered by masterminds operating from abroad.

title: Should Ladakh be granted Statehood? | In Focus podcast

description: Route marches taken out at 100 centres and public meetings in 122 places

title: In meeting with textile market stakeholders, Surat police discuss ways to keep ‘fly-by-night cheater firms’ at bay
Chhattisgarh: 103 Reds, 49 with Rs 1cr bounty on their heads, surrender in Bastar
description: Chhattisgarh delivered a significant blow to Maoists as 103 Naxals, including 49 carrying a cumulative Rs 1 crore reward, surrendered in Bijapur. Each received Rs 50,000 under the rehabilitation policy, marking a defeat for Maoist ideology and their parallel governance structures. Officials urged remaining cadres to embrace the policy, following 410 surrenders this year.

title: 'Patriotic organisation': VP says RSS embraces all; hails Sangh's 'inclusiveness'
description: Vice-President C P Radhakrishnan extended best wishes to the RSS on its centenary, praising its inclusive approach that embraces all without distinction. He highlighted its role in national progress and its "man-making ethos" for creating self-disciplined, responsible citizens. The VP described the RSS as the world's foremost patriotic organization, attributing its enduring success to fostering unity in diversity.

title: T.N. in worst position with regard to safety of Scheduled Castes, alleges Governor Ravi
description: He alleges that the SC community faced increasing problems, including not being able to walk freely on the streets and students are being divided in classrooms

title: Mumbai to get respite from heavy rain, monsoon withdrawal likely delayed: IMD
MP: Tribal girl aims to bend it like Beckham; teen to join German football club
description: Suhani Kol, a 15-year-old from Shahdol, will train at FC Ingolstadt 04 in Germany. She is one of five selected footballers for this program. Suhani, a Class X student, plays as a goalkeeper. Her journey includes overcoming personal tragedy. She leaves for Germany to train with German coach Dietmar Beiersdorfer. This opportunity marks a step for the athlete.

title: 'Review needed': Bhagwat rings ‘warning bell’ on Himalayas; flags ecology threats
description: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat warned against environmental degradation, particularly in the Himalayas, attributing it to faulty development models and consumerism. He also stressed the need for stronger security and economic self-reliance amid regional turmoil and global economic pressures. Bhagwat highlighted systemic flaws like the rich-poor gap, advocating for national unity and vigilance.

description: The Los Angeles Rams, fresh off a victory against the Colts, are preparing to face the San Francisco 49ers tonight. Star quarterback Matthew Stafford is confirmed to play despite dealing with an unconfirmed back injury, reportedly an aggravated disc. Stafford has expressed strong commitment to his team, focusing on the game rather than his pain.

Zubeen's death: Murder charge on manager, fest organiser; 2 more arrested
description: Assam Police's SIT arrested Zubeen Garg’s drummer and an actress, following earlier murder charges against his manager and a festival organiser. These developments came as the SIT probed the musical icon's death in Singapore, where he died swimming on September 19. A consolidated case under BNS charges is currently underway.

title: Caitlin Clark backs Napheesa Collier as WNBA chief Cathy Engelbert faces backlash
description: WNBA Commissioner Cathy Engelbert is under fire after Napheesa Collier revealed Engelbert's remarks suggesting Caitlin Clark should be grateful for the league's platform and sponsorships. Clark supported Collier's criticism of league leadership, emphasizing the need for accountability during this crucial time. Engelbert expressed being "disheartened" by Collier's claims but maintained her commitment to the league.

'Block Everything': Paris' Eiffel Tower closed amid nationwide protests
description: France experienced widespread strikes and protests on Thursday, disrupting daily life and closing the Eiffel Tower. Thousands marched across 200 cities, demanding higher taxes on the wealthy and opposing proposed spending cuts. Unions are pressuring new Prime Minister Lecornu to abandon austerity measures. While turnout was lower than last month, the demonstrations highlight significant social anger ahead of budget discussions.

Four districts are on high alert, with officials warned against lapses.

This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: Accenture job cuts: Company lays off thousands that can't be AI trained; what CEO said
description: Accenture has reportedly laid off thousands globally, citing employees' inability to retrain for AI roles. Despite these cuts, the company plans to expand its headcount next fiscal year, aggressively building AI capabilities and training over 550,000 staff. CEO Julie Sweet confirmed 'exiting' non-AI-aligned talent, reflecting a broader tech industry trend where adapting to AI is crucial for professional relevance.
